definitions: flat rectangular piece of material forming part of a surface
group of people gathered to discuss or judge something
board containing switches and controls for electrical equipment
group of people selected to serve on a jury
examples: The wooden panel covered the damaged wall section
Solar panels on the roof generate electricity efficiently
The expert panel discussed climate change solutions thoroughly
She served on the advisory panel for three years
The control panel displayed all the system indicators clearly
Engineers monitored the instrument panel during the test flight
The jury panel was selected from registered voters yesterday
Lawyers questioned each panel member about their impartiality

definitions: wooden boards or sheets used to cover walls as decoration
process of installing decorative panels on interior surfaces
examples: The oak paneling gave the library a distinguished appearance
They removed the outdated paneling from the basement walls
Professional paneling requires precise measurements and careful installation
The paneling work took three days to complete properly

definitions: person who serves as a member of a discussion panel
participant on a television or radio panel show
examples: Each panelist presented their research findings during the conference
The panelist answered questions from the audience thoughtfully
The game show panelist correctly guessed the mystery guest
Television panelists debated current political issues every Sunday

definitions: sudden sharp spasm of pain affecting the body
brief intense feeling of mental or emotional discomfort
examples: A sudden pang shot through her injured shoulder
Hunger pangs reminded him he hadn't eaten all day
She felt a pang of guilt about the lie
The memory brought pangs of nostalgia and regret

definitions: narrow strip of territory projecting from the main body of an area
act of begging for money in public places
examples: The Texas panhandle extends north between Oklahoma and New Mexico
Florida's panhandle stretches along the Gulf Coast beautifully
City ordinances prohibit panhandling near ATM machines downtown
Some people panhandle at busy intersections during rush hour

definitions: sudden overwhelming fear that produces hysterical or irrational behavior
widespread sudden alarm affecting many people simultaneously
sudden widespread financial crisis causing rushed selling of assets
examples: She felt panic rising as the elevator stopped suddenly
The crowd erupted in panic when the fire alarm sounded
The false bomb threat caused panic throughout the building
News of the invasion spread panic across the entire region
The bank panic of 1907 led to major financial reforms
Investors sold stocks in panic as markets crashed worldwide

definitions: unobstructed view of an extensive area in all directions
comprehensive presentation or survey of a series of events or subjects
examples: The mountaintop offered a breathtaking panorama of the valley
Tourists photographed the panorama from the observation deck eagerly
The book presents a panorama of nineteenth-century American life
His lecture provided a panorama of Renaissance art history

definitions: colorful garden flower with velvety petals resembling a face
offensive slang term for an effeminate man
examples: Purple and yellow pansies bordered the garden path beautifully
She planted pansies in the window boxes every spring
Using pansy as an insult reflects outdated prejudices completely
The term pansy is considered offensive and inappropriate today

definitions: temple dedicated to all gods of a particular religion
all the gods of a people or religion collectively
group of particularly famous or important people in a field
examples: The Roman Pantheon remains remarkably well preserved after two millennia
Tourists visit the Pantheon to see its famous dome
The Greek pantheon included Zeus, Athena, and Apollo
Ancient Egyptian pantheon contained hundreds of different deities
She joined the pantheon of great American novelists posthumously
The pantheon of jazz legends includes Louis Armstrong

definitions: large wild cat with black fur found in various regions
name used by various sports teams and organizations
examples: The black panther moved silently through the jungle undergrowth
Wildlife cameras captured images of the elusive Florida panther
The Panthers won their third consecutive championship game yesterday
Carolina Panthers fans filled the stadium to capacity

definitions: dramatic entertainment using gestures without words to convey meaning
British theatrical entertainment especially popular during Christmas season
examples: The actor's pantomime conveyed the story without speaking once
Street performers often use pantomime to entertain crowds
The children enjoyed the Christmas pantomime at the local theater
Traditional pantomimes include audience participation and comedy songs

definitions: small room or closet for storing food and kitchen supplies
large cupboard used for storing dishes and food provisions
examples: She organized the pantry shelves by food category systematically
The walk-in pantry held enough supplies for several months
The butler's pantry connected the kitchen to the dining room
They converted the closet into a functional pantry space

definitions: informal or childish word for father used affectionately
code word representing the letter P in radio communications
examples: Little Maria ran to papa with her scraped knee
Papa always told the best bedtime stories to us
The pilot said Papa November requesting permission to land
In the phonetic alphabet, papa represents the letter P

definitions: office or tenure of the Pope as head of the Catholic Church
system of church government in which the Pope has supreme authority
examples: The papacy has existed for nearly two thousand years continuously
His papacy focused on modernizing church practices and outreach
The medieval papacy wielded enormous political and spiritual power
Critics questioned the papacy's role in contemporary society

definitions: large oval tropical fruit with orange flesh and black seeds
tropical tree that produces papaya fruit native to Central America
examples: The ripe papaya had sweet orange flesh and tiny black seeds
She added papaya chunks to the tropical fruit salad
The papaya tree grew rapidly in the warm humid climate
Farmers cultivated papaya trees for both local and export markets

definitions: thin material made from wood pulp used for writing or printing
scholarly article or essay on a particular topic
newspaper or similar publication printed on paper
official documents establishing identity, ownership, or legal status
examples: She wrote the letter on cream-colored paper carefully
The printer ran out of paper during the meeting
His research paper on climate change won the academic prize
Students submitted their term papers before the deadline
The morning paper carried news of the election results
Local papers reported on the community festival extensively
Immigration papers must be carried at all times legally
The divorce papers were signed by both parties yesterday

definitions: book with a flexible paper cover rather than hard binding
edition of a book published with soft paper covers
examples: The paperback fit easily into her travel bag
Paperbacks cost significantly less than hardcover editions usually
The novel's paperback edition included a new author introduction
Publishers release paperback editions after hardcover sales decline

definitions: thick paper-based material stronger than regular paper but thinner than cardboard
sturdy paper product used primarily for packaging and containers
examples: The gift box was made from decorative paperboard material
Paperboard folders kept the documents organized and protected
Food manufacturers use paperboard for cereal boxes extensively
Recycled paperboard reduces environmental impact in packaging industry

definitions: documents required for administrative or bureaucratic processes
routine written work required in business or official matters
examples: The mortgage paperwork took hours to complete accurately
New employees must finish their paperwork before starting work
She spent Friday afternoon catching up on office paperwork
Government agencies often require extensive paperwork for permits

definitions: red powder made from dried sweet peppers used as seasoning
variety of pepper plant used to make paprika spice
examples: She sprinkled paprika on the deviled eggs for color
Hungarian goulash requires generous amounts of sweet paprika
Farmers grew paprika peppers in the warm Mediterranean climate
The paprika plant produces bright red peppers when mature

definitions: number of strokes a skilled golfer should require for a hole
state of being equal or equivalent in value or standing
nominal or face value of stocks, bonds, or currency
examples: The golfer finished two strokes under par impressively
This hole is a par four with water hazards
Her performance was on par with professional standards
The new restaurant is on par with the city's finest
The bonds were trading below par due to market conditions
Stock prices rose above par after the earnings report

definitions: simple story used to illustrate a moral or spiritual lesson
story told by Jesus Christ to convey religious teachings
examples: The parable taught important lessons about kindness and forgiveness
Ancient parables often used familiar situations to explain concepts
The parable of the prodigal son appears in Luke's gospel
Jesus used parables to make spiritual truths more accessible

definitions: symmetrical curve formed by points equidistant from a focus and directrix
u-shaped curve resulting from conic section or quadratic equation
examples: The parabola opened upward with its vertex at the origin
Students graphed parabolas in their algebra class yesterday
The satellite dish formed a perfect parabola shape
Projectile motion follows a parabolic path through space

definitions: device consisting of fabric canopy that slows descent through air
system for delivering supplies or personnel by air drop
examples: The skydiver's parachute opened at three thousand feet altitude
Emergency parachutes are mandatory equipment for small aircraft pilots
Relief supplies arrived by parachute in the disaster zone
Military units used parachutes for rapid deployment operations

definitions: sport or activity of jumping from aircraft with a parachute
military or emergency technique of deploying personnel by parachute
examples: She took up parachuting as an extreme weekend hobby
Parachuting requires extensive training and safety certification
Parachuting troops behind enemy lines proved strategically effective
Emergency parachuting saved many pilots during the war

definitions: person who engages in parachuting as sport or recreation
military personnel trained in parachute deployment operations
examples: The experienced parachutist completed her thousandth jump yesterday
Professional parachutists perform at air shows worldwide
Army parachutists trained for nighttime combat drops regularly
The parachutist landed precisely in the designated zone

definitions: public procession celebrating a special event or holiday
formal military march or ceremonial review of troops
ostentatious or boastful display of something
examples: The Thanksgiving parade featured giant balloon characters floating overhead
Thousands lined the streets to watch the victory parade
The military parade showcased the nation's armed forces impressively
Troops marched in parade formation past reviewing stands
She made a parade of her expensive jewelry at parties
His constant parade of achievements annoyed his colleagues

definitions: conceptual framework or worldview underlying theories and methodology
typical example or pattern serving as a model
set of linguistic forms sharing similar inflection patterns
examples: The scientific paradigm shifted with Einstein's theory of relativity
Researchers work within established paradigms until anomalies emerge
This case serves as a paradigm for ethical business practices
The paradigm demonstrated the standard approach to problem-solving
Latin verb paradigms show consistent conjugation patterns clearly
Students memorized paradigms to understand grammatical structures

definitions: place or state of perfect happiness and delight
heaven as the ultimate abode of the blessed after death
tropical or exotic place of exceptional beauty and tranquility
examples: The quiet library was paradise for book lovers everywhere
Their mountain cabin seemed like paradise after city stress
Many religions describe paradise as eternal reward for righteousness
The souls of the righteous enter paradise after death
The tropical island was a paradise of white beaches
Hawaii is often called a paradise for tourists

definitions: statement that appears self-contradictory but contains truth
situation exhibiting contradictory or opposing aspects simultaneously
examples: The paradox of choice suggests more options create less satisfaction
Zeno's paradox questions the nature of motion and infinity
The paradox of modern life is increased connectivity creating isolation
It's a paradox that saving money requires spending wisely

definitions: white waxy solid hydrocarbon mixture used in candles and sealing
liquid hydrocarbon mixture used as fuel or solvent
examples: Paraffin wax sealed the preserving jars completely airtight
Candle makers prefer paraffin for its clean burning properties
The heater ran on paraffin during the power outage
Paraffin oil serves as an effective cleaning solvent

definitions: sport of flying with a parachute-like canopy attached by harness
recreational activity using wind currents to soar through air
examples: Paragliding from the mountain offered spectacular valley views
She earned her paragliding certification after extensive training
Weekend paragliding attracts adventure seekers to coastal cliffs
Paragliding equipment has improved significantly in recent years

definitions: person or thing regarded as a perfect example of a quality
model of excellence or perfection in a person
examples: The building stands as a paragon of modernist architecture
This wine is a paragon of the region's winemaking tradition
She was considered a paragon of virtue and integrity
The general became a paragon of military leadership

definitions: distinct section of writing dealing with a single theme
brief article or report in a newspaper or magazine
examples: Each paragraph should contain one main idea clearly expressed
The opening paragraph captured the reader's attention immediately
The newspaper included a paragraph about the local festival
She wrote a paragraph for the community newsletter

definitions: small parrot with long tail feathers and bright plumage
popular cage bird kept as a household pet
examples: Wild parakeets flew through the tropical forest canopy
The green parakeet perched on the flowering branch
Their pet parakeet learned to mimic several words
Parakeets require daily interaction and mental stimulation

definitions: trained professional who assists lawyers with legal work
person qualified to perform legal work under attorney supervision
examples: The paralegal prepared all the case documents for review
Paralegals conduct legal research and draft correspondence regularly
She worked as a paralegal while attending law school
Certified paralegals can perform many routine legal tasks

definitions: lines or planes that never meet regardless of extension
state of being similar or corresponding in character
person or thing that is similar or comparable to another
examples: Parallel lines maintain equal distance at all points
The railroad tracks ran parallel to the highway
The parallel between the two situations was remarkably clear
Their careers followed parallel paths for many years
History offers no parallel to this unprecedented event
The ancient civilization had no parallel in architectural achievement

definitions: use of similar grammatical structures for rhetorical effect
state or quality of being parallel or similar
simultaneous execution of multiple computational processes
examples: The speech used parallelism to emphasize key points effectively
Biblical psalms often employ parallelism in their verses
The parallelism between ancient and modern conflicts is striking
Researchers noted the parallelism in evolutionary development patterns
Parallelism in computing increases processing speed significantly
The algorithm exploits parallelism for faster data analysis

definitions: four-sided plane figure with opposite sides parallel and equal
quadrilateral with two pairs of parallel sides
examples: A rectangle is a special type of parallelogram
Students calculated the area of the parallelogram using base times height
The parallelogram's diagonals bisect each other at the center
Engineers used parallelogram linkages in the mechanical design

definitions: person affected by paralysis unable to move body parts
relating to or affected by paralysis or loss of movement
examples: The paralytic required constant care and medical attention
Modern medicine offers new hope for paralytics through technology
Paralytic conditions can result from spinal cord injuries
The paralytic stroke left him unable to speak

definitions: healthcare professional providing emergency medical treatment outside hospitals
trained medical worker who responds to emergency calls
examples: Paramedics arrived within minutes of the emergency call
The paramedic stabilized the patient during transport to hospital
She trained as a paramedic after completing nursing school
Paramedics work long shifts responding to various emergencies

definitions: factor that defines or limits the scope of something
variable in mathematical equations or statistical analysis
adjustable setting that controls system or program behavior
examples: Budget constraints set the parameters for the project
We must work within the parameters established by law
Researchers adjusted the parameters in the statistical model
The parameter values determine the equation's behavior completely
System parameters can be modified in the configuration file
Default parameters optimize performance for most users

definitions: armed group organized similarly to military but not official army
force or organization using military methods outside regular forces
examples: Paramilitary forces patrolled the disputed border region
The paramilitary group operated independently of government control
Police adopted paramilitary tactics for crowd control operations
Paramilitary training prepared security personnel for various threats

definitions: mental condition characterized by delusions of persecution or grandeur
unjustified suspicion and mistrust of others
examples: Clinical paranoia requires professional psychiatric treatment and medication
His paranoia manifested as belief in elaborate conspiracy theories
Office paranoia increased after the layoff announcements
Social media can fuel paranoia about privacy breaches

definitions: person suffering from paranoia or persecution delusions
characterized by extreme and irrational suspicion or mistrust
examples: The paranoid patient believed everyone was plotting against him
Paranoid individuals often struggle with social relationships
She became paranoid about security after the break-in
His paranoid behavior alienated friends and family members

definitions: low wall along the edge of a roof, bridge, or balcony
defensive wall protecting soldiers from enemy fire
examples: The castle's parapet provided protection for defending archers
Stone parapets lined the ancient bridge across the river
Workers installed a parapet around the flat roof for safety
The building code requires parapets on all commercial roofs

definitions: miscellaneous articles or equipment needed for particular activity
equipment or accessories associated with drug use
examples: Fishing paraphernalia filled the garage from floor to ceiling
The artist's studio contained all the paraphernalia for painting
Police confiscated drug paraphernalia during the raid
Possession of drug paraphernalia carries legal penalties

definitions: expression of meaning using different words while preserving sense
act or process of restating text in alternative words
examples: The student's paraphrase captured the author's main ideas clearly
A good paraphrase demonstrates understanding of the original text
Teachers encourage paraphrase to avoid plagiarism in essays
Paraphrase skills help with note-taking and summarization

definitions: paralysis of the lower half of the body including both legs
medical condition resulting from spinal cord damage below neck
examples: Paraplegia resulted from the motorcycle accident's spinal injury
Advances in treatment offer hope for paraplegia patients
The foundation funds research into paraplegia and rehabilitation methods
Living with paraplegia requires significant lifestyle adaptations

definitions: island country in the Caribbean Sea known for spice production
sovereign state in the West Indies north of Trinidad
examples: Grenada exports nutmeg and other spices worldwide
Tourism contributes significantly to Grenada's economy
The capital of Grenada is St. George's
Grenada gained independence from Britain in 1974
